transcript.content: Coldplay… “The Scientist”… you seen the video of that?

I, I think I might’ve worked out what, what it, he’s, he’s walking backwards, it’s all filmed backwards but he’s singing forward. Now the only way I can work out they’ve done it, without CGI in it and cheating with the lips, is that… he had to…
Learn how to sing it backwards.
…learn it backwards and did it sort of like bit by bit, did he do that?
He was on Zoe’s show, like, about a week ago…
…so he learned phrases and then he filmed that.
But he didn’t learn the whole song, did he, they must’ve, he couldn’t possibly have learnt the whole song, they must’ve, like, stopped it and…
It’s a great video, though. They always do a good video.
No, it’s very good, very good indeed.
So it was uh, yeah, “The Scientist” on Xfm 104.9, I’m Ricky Gervais, with me, Steve Merchant and Karl Pilkington.
I had a bit of good news this morning, Rick.

Uhm, I was on the tube coming down, and I don’t ah… I don’t want sound arrogant, I don’t want to sound pushy, but uhm… I was at Green Park, and I’m fairly certain, Rick, it’s not a hundred percent corroborated, I’m fairly certain… that a woman pinched my arse. So what do you think of that? Yes.
But the—there’s a lot of pock—uh, pickpockets around Green Park so be careful.
No no no no no, no no no no no, my wallet was still there.
But even if it wasn’t, you know, that would’ve been money well spent but…
…but… but the… but the wallet was still there so how, what do you think of them apples? Eh?
So what did you—did she just pinch your arse and then…
I don’t, I can’t confirm it at this stage, uh, exactly what happened but it certainly felt like a pinch. I looked round, there was…
She was fairly old, she was, I th—she was probably in her mid-30s…
…uh, I don’t know if she’s listening…
…but, uh, she knows where I am. And, uhm… so I don’t know how to proceed, really, Rick, I don’t know if it’s worth putting up some posters…
Just to try and corroborate it. If you saw a woman pinch a lanky guy’s arse…
No, you could, you could probably get in, uh, contact with British Rail and loo—go back over their CCTV thing…
…and then, they could probably zoom in and, you know, sort of identifying sort of birthmarks or she might’ve been holding summat.
And I could hire a private eye.
Well, so, uh, there you go.
So, you know, I’m just saying that, I’m just saying maybe that, maybe things are looking up.
Eh? I don’t—I, you know, that’s a little sexy story to get the show going.
So what do you make of that, then, Karl?
What do you think of that, Karl?
Well… I mean… you’re quite, quite a tall fella.
So… she must’ve really wanted to sort of… reach up and… and have a pinch.
…she did it with her teeth? What are you saying?
You’re not thinking she was a dwarf.
No, no, but Steve’s taller than, you know, his arse…
Yeah, but his arse isn’t 6 foot 9, is it? His arse is about 3 foot off the floor.
Four foot off… off the floor?
Uh, no, I don’t think so, about three—she’d have to be a midget to have to reach up to pinch Steve’s arse, he is very tall. But…
I don’t know what your point is there, Karl, you’re just see—you’re just trying to, you know, you’re just…
…maybe you’re just a little bit jealous! Just a little bit of jealousy.
Well, do you know what happened to me on the way in?
Homeless person called me a dickhead.
Do you know him? Is that why?
He’s a local, he’s like the local…
And he know, he knows me, he sees me walking up and down the street.
Oh, that’s how he knew you.

Right? So uhm… so normally I’d have a, I’d have a bit of a chat with him an’ that, and I walked past him. And uhm, wi—wi—you know, I can, I can be a little bit cheeky with him ‘cause I’ve been cheeky with him in the past, with stuff. Uhm…
No, no, just saying stuff like, “God, you’re always here, haven’t you got a home to go to,” and…
Just breaking the ice, just breaking the ice, go on.
No, he knows, and he’d laughed at that, right, last time…

…so I thought I can be a bit cheeky, right? So he goes, uh, he goes, “Do you want a… do you want a Big Issue?” I said, “Nah.” He said, “Come on, I’ve got loads of ‘em,” right? So I, I sort of said, “Oh, when I was a kid, and I used to do a free paper round of free papers, well, I just put them in a bin and go home.”
Right? And he went, “But how am I gonna get any money doing that, you dickhead?”
You see… I can see his point.
He is homeless, and having to sell… newspapers, to get 50p or a quid or whatever.

Yeah. And sometimes I treat him, right, and… today I didn’t have any money, I had a takeaway last night and I normally give them a quid. And I felt bad not being able to do that, ‘cause I didn’t have any money on me…
…last night. I couldn’t look him in the eye…
Did you explain this to the homeless person, the traumas of the takeaway without the tip?
Did you explain that, you know, you’ve had it hard as well. I’d go, “Look, you don’t know—”
“I had food delivered to my warm flat…”

“You don’t know what that’s like, you don’t know what the trauma is ‘cause you can’t have food delivered to your flat ‘cause you haven’t got one. So please don’t look at me like that.” You should’ve said.
But most people ignore him. At least I gave him a bit of acknowledgment and sort of…
Yeah, took the, took the mick.
I didn’t think I was, I just was being friendly.
You’ve got to be careful with the homeless ‘cause I, this is true, I, this is true and this is, I, you know when the clocks went, was it the clocks went back recently…
…so you got an extra hour in bed?

And uhm, I was at a cashpoint with a friend of mine, and there was a homeless person sat by the cashpoint, and ahm… we were getting some money out, she said, “Spare some change.” And my friend went, “Hhrr,” he was a bit awkward, he was just trying to make conversation with her and he went, “Ohh… clocks go back… extra hour in bed…”
I gave her two quid, I felt so bad.
He didn’t do it intentionally, he didn’t realize what he’d said.
It’s tricky making conversation with the homeless. ‘Cause there’s so many areas you can’t, you’ve got to avoid…
…you know, what was on the telly…
Although I get recognized by homeless people and… are they, I don’t know where they…
But you’ve got to remember that’s very much your demographic, Rick…
…people who watch TV through the window at Dixons.
…yeah, in Dixons, yeah, they go, “Ricky Gervais is on…”
Well, they, they can smell the alcohol on you, they think you’re one of them.
Oh, I’ve had to cut down on that. Oh, I’ve been really good for this training thing.
I… oh. Oh. Play a record and I’ll tell you about that, I had my first week of training, I am, I’m in… trouble, I’m struggling.
What do you want to play?
Oh, what have we got, have we got a bit of uh… have we? Stone Roses, classic.
Stone Roses – I Wanna Be Adored
Feeder, “Come Back Around,” Xfm 104.9… Ricky Gervais, Steve Merchant, Karl Pilkington. All right?

Yeah, so I st—I had my first week of training for this, uhm, charity boxing. Uhm, for those people who don’t know, I’m, I’m fighting Grant Bovey… ah, Anthea Turner’s husband. Ahm… it’s a, it sounds arbitrary but it’s actually because he’s, uh, 41 and about my weight, bit taller, I think, but ah… and we’ve never done it before, but uhm… no, but it’ll be fun.

Uhm… no, but uhm, it, it, it’s, and I can’t believe my luck, because I, you know, I’ve been a fight fan for, like, 30 years and, uhm… and they took me shopping, they bought me all the gear. The training’s great, it’s really hard, I mean, it’s… uh, I imagined it’d be really hard and it’s probably slightly harder than I imagined. And the only bit I like s—the, the, I, I… I don’t like all the exercise and all the stuff you’ve gotta do, I like the bits that look a bit like summat I’ve seen in a “Rocky” film.
You know, we do that thing where the uh… the string along the ring and I have to pop up and punch and that…
Skipping’s not bad, I’m trying to get good at that. I like that ball that you…
Ricky imitates sound of punching speed bags
Yeah, yeah. Are you any good at that, is that…?
Ah, I’m getting… getting good at it.
And what’s that teaching you, that particular thing, it’s just the rhythm, is it?
Ah, it’s, it’s rhythm and, of course, your arms are up for that long so it… it, you’ve got to keep your guard up all the time.
So that teaches you to keep your arms up.
And you were… ah, up at six this morning, you broke some raw eggs into a cup and then you ran up the steps of the town hall, didn’t you…
With l—with loads of people following me, and I shouted, “Bovey!”
…at the top. No, I’m not going mad, I’m not going mad.
Just, just, just, you know, once every, you know, every other day.
But I’m struggling now, I f—,I f—,I f—… I woke up today and it was like I’d been… hit by a car.

Just everything aches, all the muscles you haven’t used. But uhm… uh anyway, I had a meeting, uh, first time with the, with the people, the programme makers, ‘cause they’re following me for a month and everything, and Grant as well. Uhm… and they said, “Oh, uhm, uh… you’ll need a sort of nickname, just for a laugh.” And I went uh, “Oh, what’s Grant using?” and he said, “Oh, I think he’s gonna use Gorgeous Grant Bovey or… Gra—” “Oh, I don’t know, uhm…” I’ll go, so I be—I’d better go against that, uhm… “What about, uhm, Ricky Gyppo Gervais?”

Yeah, and I, right, laughed, “It’s all right.” Anyway, I had a freeting with Frank Moloney, meeting the next day, and uh… you know, you got to… do this nickname, and the bloke said, “Oh, I checked out that name, you can’t call yourself Gyppo,” I went… “Well, of course, I can’t, I was joking!”
He went, “What?” I said, “Well, it’s racist! I was… joking, I was making a joke about me being…” And he went, “Oh.” And then, uh, I went down to get the, uhm, buy all the gear from this shop…
They’d had a dressing gown made?

Yeah. Yeah! Yeah. And I was picking all the stuff, I was, like, “Look, that’s like Nas wore. Oh, look, that’s like Ali wore in uh…” And I’m going, “I’ll have that, I’ll have that,” picking all the gear and everything. And, uhm… there was a couple of boxers down there, sort of, like, looking at me, thinking, “Who’s that fat bloke…”

“…taking up boxing at 40?” And uh… I s—said who I was and… uh, bloke went, “Oh, yeah, how are you doing?” and I went, “Oh, yeah, how long have you been in the game?” and he said, “I’ve been boxing 20 years,” I said, “How many fights have you had?” and he said, “About 40.” I said, “Oh, yeah, help me, I’ve got to uh… think of a nickname. And I thought,” I said, uh, “I thought, uh, Ricky Balboa Gervais.” He went, “Right,” I went, “Or Ricky Marciano Gervais.” He looked at me and went, “What about Ricky Martin?”
Yeah, I, I’m not respected yet in the boxing world…
It’s only a matter of time, once they see you fight.
Once they see you fight, Rick…
Have you actually, have you actually punched anyone yet, have you actually…?
Not any—no, I haven’t punched a person…
…I’ve punched pads and I’ve punched a, the bag and I’ve sort of sparred and that. I…
And are you gonna get a chance to punch someone?
Well, well, as I suspected, uhm, my, my punching power’s all right but my fitness is… I mean, I felt like I was smoking.
You know, but… you know, there’s bits of lung that haven’t been, haven’t had oxygen in them for 20 years.
And it’s ridiculous. And also because… it’s not only that it’s being filmed, there’s other fighters there that are ridiculous, they’re like machines, right?
And it’s that thing, I’d go, I could go, “Right, I can, I can come out on top but die now of a heart attack, but never give up…”
…or I can sit down and go, “I’m sorry, I’m…”
“…I feel ill.” And I chose that one and, of course, they took the mick.
Well, of course, you know, absolutely.
But I, you know, soon, I, as I said, I haven’t got the respect yet of the boxing fraternity…
And how long have you got then before…?
Okay, so, and, and do they think they, they can turn you around health-wise in that time?
Or will you be coming out in… for the fight?
No, they, they’re gonna teach me the ba—basics and see how it goes, you know.
And each round is… four seconds, is that right?
With a, with a two-hour break in between each one.
So uh, give the number out, I want, I want serious suggestions of my fighting name. Nothing insulting, summat we can actually use…
Well, let’s give out the email address…
…ricky dot gervais at xfm dot co dot uk, what’s the number, Karl?
And it doesn’t have to be in the middle, it could be at the beginning, like…
Ice Cube – It Was a Good Day
“It Was a Good Day,” yeah, Ice Cube… talks to me about my life.

Couple of emails already coming in, rush—they’re flooding in, Rick, inevitably, as boxing name suggestions for you. Here’s one from Matt, I think, uh, he’s given a couple, actually, Ricky “The Pudding” Gervais.
Ahm… I, there’s a theme here, Ricky “Pasty” Gervais.
“The Pasty,” I quite like “The Pasty.” “Here comes the Pasty.”

The thing is, Karl said, “The thing is, if you have a really good nickname, it’s embarrassing when you lose, whereas if you just call yourself yourself it’s not so embarrassing when you lose.” Karl… this isn’t doing that good for my ego!
But d’you know what I mean, if you have, like, Killer Gervais…
Yeah, and then you end up, like, vomiting…
…choking on your own vomit upside-down hanging out of the ring…
What happens if you win, do you have to…
Whereas, “There goes the Pasty being stretchered off—”
…uh, “and chucked down a mine.” What do you mean, what do I have to do?
Say if you, say if you beat Grant, say…
What do you mean, what happens next, what… do you think I would—this is a, a contention fight, the big one?
No no no, but do they, I mean…
No, but, you know… do you know if they’re planning on making more money, ‘cause it’s for Comic Relief, innit? So what happens on the night…
No, it’s for, no, it’s for charity—
It was last time, I think it was last time that it…
Is it Sport Relief, it’s not Sport Relief?
It was last time, yeah, but this is, I think this is a programme where the…
And how, how do we, sorry, how does this, how do you make money for charity from this, do we, do we pay to, to sort of, how many punches to the head you’re gonna take or…
…I assume the BBC donate… money, or someone or a sponsor or whoever it is, I don’t know, just…
…donate money, ‘cause it’s actually a programme, this is more about a programme, with a…
…with a charity angle. So, uh, yeah.
So if, so if you get, like, killed, there’s more money and food to go around…
…maybe. Well, no, I mean, the thing is, what’s the next step, because… if they go, like, “Right, yeah, well done, you’ve won… thank you very much.”
Wh—Karl, what do you expect, that they, that it’s winner-stays-on?
Like in a fair? Where I go, they’d let people punch me…
Yeah! Yeah. And the—and then my twin gets up.
Wh—what do you, what, it’s just a… it’s a programme.
Yeah, but what’s the point if it’s not gonna go anywhere?
Sorry, him fighting Grant Bovey in a ring is not entertainment enough?
Yeah! What’s the matter with you, Karl?!
The man’s gonna get his face pummelled in, that’s gonna be hilarious!
No, look, right, when I did boxing at the youth club…
Once! “When he did boxing…” He fought once, he fought a little weak kid, ‘cause it was his first day, battered him, next week it was someone else’s turn and he got battered and he left.
Yeah, I said, “Right, I’ve had enough.” But it was, it was…
…there was a ladder there, that I had to work, right, and I decided after the, sort of, the, the first step, I thought, “It’s not for me, this.”
But, if you win it’s all kinda like, “Right, well… there you go.”
But it’s a programme. It’s just a one-off programme, isn’t it? It’s li—it is like, you gotta treat it like… “Faking It.”
Yeah, but “Faking It,” right, that little gay fella who ended up being a doorman, he’s actually doing that as a proper job now or something, he loved it so much.
Do you seriously think I have any intentions of getting into the fight game and leaving entertainment behind?
What, what do you mean, what’s the point in, what’s, what’s the point in watching television? It’s entertainment!
Or educational. I, I watch it to sort of soak in…

Well, this is educational, I’m learning a lot! I am actually learning a lot and it’s, I can’t believe my luck. I’ve got professionals telling me, you know, hopefully how to lose weight and punch hard. It’s just fun, it’s like, like having golf lessons.
Right, say, I mean, here’s an example.
It’s a, it’s a nice way to plug it, we’ve got Rockbusters coming up in about ten minutes or something, right?
People, people email in and they don’t just do it for fun, they do it ‘cause they know we’ve got some good prizes lined up.
So they’re doing it because it gets them something.

Yeah, my, my prize is that I’ve learnt something in life, I’ve gone through an experience, and hopefully I come out in some way better… if I don’t get mashed. That’s it, that’s the prize, that’s why we do anything, isn’t it?
I think this is su—this is an example of you, Karl, is you give up too easy.
Yeah, and you don’t, you don’t…
You know, you took up the boxing, you gave that up straight away.
…you think there’s no point in anything.
I did, I did Crusaders, for a... I think I lasted that out for about four weeks.
Well… it was, me mate, right, he uh…
And I, and I’m not, really, uhm… but…
No, I mean, you believe in ghosts, though, and shadows pushing people off bikes, but go on.
…but at the same time, I think I told you once before that I went to the church with this lad…
…because I swore and he said was gonna tell me dad…
…I was effin’ and jeffin’. So he said…
Is that how they get people to church nowadays?
I lo—I love that, a kid, yeah, he hasn’t quite got, uh, got the idea of the protection game.
There was nothing in it for him. “Either you turn to religion or I tell your father.”

Right, so uh… so I went to church with him an’ that, and then the next week he said, “I know that was rubbish and you didn’t enjoy it,” it’s when I got kicked out for messing with a tennis ball in the pews, right?
I don’t think we’ve heard that but… I don’t think we can possibly go into that now.
You had a tennis ball and some pubes.
But anyway, so I w—I went there, I said, “I don’t think much of this church thing, it’s a bit boring.”
Sorry… and so you went to church and you ended up… in the Crusades?
…they’re called Crusaders, what it is, it’s meant to be the fun part of religion, for kids.
And my mate said, “You wanna come along, it’s uh, you know, you go on a Friday night…”
“…and, uh, do it on a Sunday as well.”
So I went on a Friday night, it was brilliant, they had Subbuteo…
…uh, I played table tennis, in this dead-big old house…
And what did they do at the end, say, “I hope you enjoyed yourself, remember God gave you all this”?
Well, they, it’s sort of, enjoy the simple things in life, you don’t need computer games, you can play, uh, table tennis an’ that... and, and talk with your friends…
…and blah blah blah. I thought, “Yeah, that’s all right.”
I think you’d be happy in a Young Offenders Institution.
You get to clean the toilets there as well.
But don’t forget, Karl, I think God invented Nintendo, too.
Right, well, anyway, so that was all right, I loved it on a Friday…
…and me mate said if you go for four weeks, four, like, weeks in a row without missing a day…
…uh, you get a free badge, and I went…
…“Aww, I don’t, I don’t, I don’t like all this sort of being stuck in stuff,” you know, that’s why I didn’t do well at school.
Yeah, you don’t wanna get tied down.
D’you know what I mean, it’s like, aww, everyday.
Right, so, uhm, anyway, so he said, “You gotta come again on Sunday,” so I thought, “Well, we’ll have another game of table tennis, it’ll be all right.”
So anyway, I go on a Sunday…
Who was this, who was this servant of God?
…I go on a Sunday, it’s like a totally different club, there’s no table tennis…
Aww. It’s like a timeshare thing!
… I was, like, “Hang on a minute, right?”
So, so I didn’t go again on Sundays, I just go on a Friday.
Just go on a Friday, brilliant! Brilliant. I’m amazed no one else saw through that.
Well… well, the thing is, there used to be loads there on a Friday so they won’t…
…they won’t even notice if, that I’m not, like…
…d’you know what I mean? That I’m not showing up on a Sunday. So anyway, uh, carried on, it was…
Just this kid and a vicar.
Aww, I love that, you, you got one over on, on the church.
So I, I was loving it, right, playing table tennis an’ that…
…they found out where I live, and the head fella started coming round, knocking on the door.
…the fella who, like, ran the club, he started coming round knocking on the door. And I saw him coming up the path and I said to me mam, “Aww, it’s the fella from the Crusaders…”
…she didn’t even know what I was…
No. She thought you were off nicking hubcaps and stealing cars.
…she didn’t have a clue what I was talking about…
“You’ve been to church, I don’t believe it!”
“That’s not how we brought you up!”
So, uh, I said, “Look, just tell him I’m not in, I’m not in,” and she had to keep doing this and they were coming round every Sunday to try and make me, like…
…go on a Sunday, and it was really important that I went and that I was abusing the system and all this. Anyway, I didn’t go, uhm, and then…
Why didn’t they just tell you, uhm, next time you turned up on a Friday?
No, well, I’d… because there were so many people there on a Friday, you just get mixed in in the crowd.
It was jammed, it was well popular on a Friday.

Right? But anyway, one of the Sundays, uhm, it was, it was quiet for a bit, and, uhm… they stopped coming round, so I thought, “Right, I can go out again,” right, “on a Sunday,” ‘cause I used to avoid hanging around the house in case they…
What sort of reign of terror…
…so I thought, “Great, they forgot about me…”
…uh, “Everything, I can carry on me, sort of, me normal life now…”
…and I, I was playing out in the avenue, fella comes round…

…and he goes, “There you are, you’re, you know, you’re always busy on a Sunday. Uh, you enjoy Fridays an’ that, don’t ya?” I was like, “Yeah, yeah.” He goes, “Come on, you’ve got to come with me,” and I couldn’t get out of it.
D’you know what I mean, I, it’s, like, what could I say?
So, uhm… anyway, he nearly killed me in a car crash.
So that was the excuse I used next time, he had a Mini, right…
…and he was driving us there, and he hit the curb, nearly sort of turned over the Mini…
…there was, like, three of us in the back. So, I said…

…next time he came round to pick us up I said, “Look, really enjoyed it an’ that,” I said, “but ever since that journey I really, you know, I don’t, I don’t want to get in the car with you again ‘cause… you scared me a bit.”
And he said, “All right, then.” I didn’t have to go again.
He almost killed you in a car crash.
It’s a parable, thank—thank God no one was hurt!
Your life moves in incredible ways.
Yeah. So uh... they’re prob—they’re probably round there now, aren’t they? Going, “Is he coming tomorrow?”
Well… will we talk about the prizes next?

Yeah, well, let’s talk about the prizes, we’ve got the big game, Rockbusters coming your way soon, Rick, I know you’re excited about that. And I, is there more Educating Ricky this week, have we got that planned?
There is, we are struggling on that feature a bit now ‘cause I feel like we, we’ve covered a lot of topics.
I know, well, I know about hairy Chinese kids…
…and deaf people that hit their head and can hear again.
So I don’t think there’s lots more to learn in life!
The Hives – Hate to Say I Told You So
…and… the amazing… Karl Pilkington. Right. Prizes.
It’s uh… one of the big exciting quiz shows, and this may be one of your last chances to play, there’s rumors that it’s gonna get ditched, Rick.
Rumors there that Karl Pilkington, the creator and mastermind behind it, has already grown tired of it.
So from, you heard them early on, “The Best of the Stone Roses,” from that we played uh…
…“I Wanna Be Adored,” that’s one of the prizes, that’s a nice little, uh, Christmas compilation.
“Fifty Years of the Greatest Hit Singles,” I tell you, there’s some great stuff on here…
One of the, one of the big—biggest, uh, number-ones of all time.
…if you’ve not heard that enough already, you’re followed then by, uh, John Lennon’s “Imagine,” “Candle in the Wind,” Elton John, you’ve got uh…
These are some of the greatest rock minds…
They’ve chosen some of the best songs by some of the best artists…
…uh, that’s on there. Uh, we’ve got ah… let me see…

That is pretty impressive, though, ‘cause they are real big, classic number-ones as opposed to, you know, the, the, the song by the artist they didn’t really care about. You see those things on, uh, “This is not available in the shops.” And it’s, you know, the second best song artists have done.
It seems odd that we’re giving it away on Xfm includ—, ‘cause it includes, uh, Robbie Williams’ “Angels”…

…Spice Girls’ “Wannabe,” Kylie Minogue’s “Can’t Get You Out of My Head,” and I think it closes, well, it almost closes with Steps’ “Tragedy,” that’s the penultimate track, it ends, though… uh, any ideas? Big, big hit single… “Do They Know It’s Christmas?” Band Aid, perfect for your, uh, Christmas party.
Uh, we’ve also got the, uh, Groove Armada current album, is that from…?

…and signed by the man himself… the “Big Beach Boutique,” uh, DVD, Fatboy Slim’s, uh, concert on that, Brighton Beach. And, uh, there’s all kinds of treats on there… uh, and includes a, uhm, an audio commentary…
…by Nor—by Norman Cook, I don’t know how that works, three hours of him going, “This is where the needle almost jumps…”
“…watch out for that. I do a little bit of scratching, I’m not very good at scratching but just look forward to that.”
“This, uh, I’m putting a, putting a different track, you’ll see me there… there’s the crowd loving it…”
“Here’s me, uh, I’m just try—this is where I g—I put, I go from, uh, I go from Conga Squad to Basement Jaxx.”

…climbed in, gone, “Last one to the moon is a bender…”

If you’re not familiar with it, uh, on Saturdays the Sun newspaper, uhm, asks a typical white van driver questions, uh, his opinions on the week’s news. And, uh, we thought we’d throw these in the direction of Karl. Ahm…

…anyway, what do you make, ah, what do you make of, ah… this teenage thug, Karl, Mikey Carroll, who spent four months in jail and he’s won 9.7 million on the, uh, lottery? Is that justice? When you think of all the good people that are going hungry? And there’s a lad there and he’s won…
Did he buy the ticket before he went in?
Uh, no, I think he bought it once he’d come out.
So he’s been—he’s done his time?
Fair enough, then, he’s, he’s been punished…
…right? He’s… bought a ticket, he’s had a lot of bad luck…
…now he’s having a bit of good luck.
Are you concerned now that he’s got all that money he could turn into, like, a sort of mastermind villain, you know, like a James Bond-style villain?
He’s got a criminal streak, we know that.
Is that a concern for you, well, imagine that…
…he could build some kind of underwater fortress.
…we don’t, we don’t, with, with my lawyer’s hat on, we don’t know that.
Well, he’d have to prove that he didn’t have a criminal streak.
I’d say, “Have you been in jail for four months?”
Yeah, but sometimes people are bad because they haven’t got any money so he might be…
…an angel of gold now or whatever.
Uh… one in five children aged between 11 and 16 go on booze binge sessions at least once a week. That’s terrifying news, isn’t it?
Kids… they, they know, they know too much now.

Me, me dad had me niece in the car, right, running her to, to school one day. And, uh… she’s in the back of the car… with a mate… and they’re chatting away about stuff like kids do… ahm, and they got on to the topic of one of their mates who they said, I mean, you’ve got to remember, me niece, this point was probably about… five or six, something like that, right, in the back of the car talking about My Little Pony or whatever it is they play with. Uh, subject changed, uhm, “Oh, that Lisa in, uh, in our class, she’s a lesbian, in’t she?”
That was the to—that’s what they were talking about here. Chatting away about it.
Yeah. And probably, you know, this is the topic that they’re talking about in the pub, when they’re having uh…
Yeah. But they might’ve thought a lesbian was a, a, a, you know, a, a funny word or something, you know, there’s, they don’t necessarily know the ins and outs of it, do they?

It’s, it’s weird, though, innit, ‘cause when I was, when I was younger at school you didn’t, like, I mean you swore a little bit but it wasn’t like major swear words. And you sort of did a little bit of nicking but nothing like they get up to now. I mean…
My, my, uhm, girlfriend, when she was about… seven or eight, she was walking to school with her mum, and she called her a c-u-n… right?
